data.title: White Fang Essay - 837 Words
data.meta_description: Free Essay: The name of the book is White Fang. It is written by Jack London. It was published by Scholastic, in New York, in 2012. There are 252 pages in...
data.text:
The name of the book is White Fang. It is written by Jack London. It was published by Scholastic, in New York, in 2012. There are 252 pages in this book. The main characters are White Fang, he is a part wolf and a part dog; Kiche, she is White Fang’s mother; Weedon Scott, he is the man who transforms White Fang from a wild beast into a civilized animal; Gray Beaver, he is the first owner of White Fang and the man who shows no affection for his dog; Beauty Smith, he is a cruel, greedy and persistent man who is the antagonist of the story and; One eye, he is White Fang’s father. It takes place in the 1860s, at the Yukon Territory, Canada.

The story starts out when Henry and Bill are taking the coffin with their dogs. They feel that a group of wolves are following them. The one main problem that arises in the story, and continues throughout it is that White Fang had created resentment to people and some animals. Therefore, in the story we can see that White Fang is cruel and aggressive toward any living being. The climax happens when White Fang starts to fight with Cherokee, the bulldog. Things start to change after that when Weedon Scott enters to White Fang’s life. The love of this man is something that White Fang has not had experienced before. The kindness of Scott to White …show more content…

I would have attacked Cherokee before he attack first. In consequence, he would not have many injuries. If I were Beauty Smith I would have done things differently. I would not have used White Fang for my own benefits. If I were Grey Beaver, I would have done things differently to deal with the problems. I would not turned to an alcoholic person. In consequence, I would not have missed White Fang. If I were Bill, I would not have followed the she-wolf and the other dogs. If he had not had follow them, he would be alive.
